bug.author: lilacbeauty
bug.summary: IO Error while classify one image using MNIST_LeNet model
bug.description: Classify One Image Owner: lilacbeauty MNIST_LeNet Image Classification Model Classification failed, see job log Tensorflow support disabled. 2018-09-26 22:44:50 [ERROR] IOError: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/nvidia/DIGITS/digits/tools/inference.py", line 293, in args['resize'] File "/home/nvidia/DIGITS/digits/tools/inference.py", line 56, in infer model = Job.load(model_dir) File "/home/nvidia/DIGITS/digits/job.py", line 37, in load with open(filename, 'rb') as savefile: IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/nvidia/DIGITS/digits/jobs/20180926-224358-dda9/status.pickle'

comments.comment: I checked in folder /home/nvidia/DIGITS/digits/jobs/20180926-224358-dda9/. There is a file named status.pickle.tmp. I changed that file's name into 'status.pickle'. now I have another error. "2018-09-28 18:50:52 [DEBUG] 20180926-224358-dda9 - EOFError:"
Your question is the same as mine. have you solved it? If you solve this problem, please give me some suggestions.Thanks.
I have same issue. I used LeNet also, and it caused on classifying one
I have same issue. Have anyone solved it?

Getting same issue on a different model. Same behavior where job has a file status.pickle.tmp, so I get an IO error where the status.pickle file is not found. Tensorflow support disabled. 2019-04-19 10:27:34 [ERROR] IOError: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/digits/digits/tools/inference.py", line 293, in args['resize'] File "/usr/local/digits/digits/tools/inference.py", line 56, in infer model = Job.load(model_dir) File "/usr/local/digits/digits/job.py", line 37, in load with open(filename, 'rb') as savefile: IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/usr/local/digits/digits/jobs/20190418-135227-21e0/status.pickle'
I am having the same exact problem. Has anyone found out how to solve it? I'm using DIGITS in CPU mode on Ubuntu 16.04.
I have this issue too with Ubuntu 16.04, Cuda 9.0, Caffe 0.15, GTX 1080
I found this problem too.But when i run the devserver, i found that my pyparsing version was wrong ,i reinstalled it use pip ,and it works.

Just to indicate that I also encountered this problem and solution for me seems to be the patch by uhfband referenced in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/issues/2024>#2024</denchmark-link>
I also encountered this problemï¼Œso how can i do?

For all: You need to install DIGTIS strictly by its document. Web pages related are shown as follows: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/blob/master/docs/BuildProtobuf.md>https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/blob/master/docs/BuildProtobuf.md</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/blob/master/docs/BuildCaffe.md>https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/blob/master/docs/BuildCaffe.md</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/blob/master/docs/BuildDigits.md>https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/blob/master/docs/BuildDigits.md</denchmark-link>
In summary, you need to install protobuf3 firstly, then install caffe from NVIDIA, then install DIGITS. In this order, your DIGITS will test image successfully.
